subject: Law
title: Theft, Robbery, and Burglary
description: A fast breakdown of Theft, Robbery, and Burglary for builders.

hook.text: People use theft, robbery, and burglary interchangeably. Legally, they're three completely different crimes.

buildup.text: Theft is taking someone's property without consent. It's the broadest category of property crime.

discovery.text: Robbery is theft plus force or threat of force. The violence element makes it far more serious.

twist.text: Burglary is entering a building with intent to commit a crime inside. You don't even have to steal anything.

climax.text: A burglar who enters a home but gets scared off has still committed burglaryâ€”the entry plus intent is enough.

punchline.text: Theft takes property. Robbery uses force. Burglary enters buildings.

quiz.question: What makes robbery different from simple theft?
options: The use of force or threat
